name: ElasticLoadBalancingListenerPropertyType
description: The Listener property is an embedded property of the AWS::ElasticLoadBalancing::LoadBalancer type.

properties.name: InstancePort
properties.description: Specifies the TCP port on which the instance server is listening. This property cannot be modified for the life of the load balancer.

properties.name: InstanceProtocol
properties.description: Specifies the protocol to use for routing traffic to back-end instances—HTTP, HTTPS, TCP, or SSL. This property cannot be modified for the life of the load balancer.

properties.name: LoadBalancerPort
properties.description: Specifies the external load balancer port number. This property cannot be modified for the life of the load balancer.

properties.name: PolicyNames
properties.description: A list of ElasticLoadBalancing policy names to associate with the listener.

properties.name: Protocol
properties.description: Specifies the load balancer transport protocol to use for routing — HTTP, HTTPS, TCP or SSL. This property cannot be modified for the life of the load balancer.

properties.name: SSLCertificateId
properties.description: The ARN of the SSL certificate to use. For more information about SSL certificates, see Managing Server Certificates in the AWS Identity and Access Management documentation.
